conclusion: Average velocity is total displacement divided by total time.
Displacement is represented by the area under the curve on a velocity-time graph.
For Car A, the area under the curve from t=0 to t=t1 represents its displacement.
For Car B, the area under the curve from t=0 to t=t1 represents its displacement.
The area under the curve for Car A is greater than for Car B.
Car A has a larger displacement compared to Car B during the time interval.
Both cars are considered over the same time interval Î”t = t1.
Average velocity of Car A is greater than that of Car B.
